title: Espanso Config File Schema
description: The schema for config.yml files for the open source program Espanso (see https://Espanso.org)

backend.description: The mechanism used to perform the injection. Espanso can either inject text by simulating keypresses (`Inject` backend) or by using the clipboard (`Clipboard` backend). Both of them have pros and cons, so the `Auto` backend is used by default to automatically choose the most appropriate one based on the situation. If for whatever reason the `Auto` backend is not appropriate, you can change this option to override it..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

clipboard_threshold.description: Number of chars after which a match is injected with the clipboard backend instead of the default one. This is done for efficiency reasons, as injecting a long match through separate events becomes slow for long strings. This is only relevant if the backend is set to `Auto`.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

backspace_limit.description: How many backspace espanso tracks to correct misspelled keywordsMaximum number of backspace presses espanso keeps track of. For example, this is needed to correctly expand even if typos are typed..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

inject_delay.description: Number of milliseconds between text injection events. Increase if the target application is missing some characters..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

key_delay.description: Number of milliseconds between key injection events. Increase if the target application is missing some key events. For example, increasing might help if the trigger is not deleted completely..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

pre_paste_delay.description: Delay (in ms) that espanso should wait to trigger the paste shortcut after copying the content in the clipboard. This is needed because if we trigger a "paste" shortcut before the content is actually copied in the clipboard, the operation will fail. If you see previous contents of the clipboard being inserted instead of the correct replacement, increase this value.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

paste_shortcut_event_delay.description: Number of milliseconds between keystrokes when simulating the Paste shortcut. For example: CTRL + (wait 5ms) + V + (wait 5ms) + release V + (wait 5ms) + release CTRL. This is needed as sometimes (for example on macOS), without a delay some keystrokes were not registered correctly..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

restore_clipboard_delay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before restoring the previous clipboard content after an expansion. This is needed as without this delay, sometimes the target application detects the previous clipboard content instead of the expansion content..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

evdev_modifier_delay.description: Extra delay to apply when injecting modifiers under the EVDEV backend (Wayland). This is useful on Wayland if espanso is injecting seemingly random cased letters, for example "Hi theRE1" instead of "Hi there!". Increase if necessary, decrease to speed up the injection..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes (but on Wayland there is currently no support for App-specific configs)

win32_keyboard_layout_cache_interval.description: The maximum interval (in milliseconds) for which a keyboard layout can be cached. If switching often between different layouts, you could lower this amount to avoid the "lost detection" effect described in this issue: [https://github.com/federico-terzi/espanso/issues/745](https://github.com/federico-terzi/espanso/issues/745).  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

enable.description: If false, Espanso will be disabled for the current configuration. This option can be used to selectively disable espanso when using a specific application (by creating an app-specific config)..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

disable_x11_fast_inject.description: NOTE: This is only relevant on Linux under X11 environments. Switch to a slower (but sometimes more supported) way of injecting key events based on XTestFakeKeyEvent instead of XSendEvent. From my experiements, disabling fast inject becomes particularly slow when using the Gnome desktop environment..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

auto_restart.description: If true, instructs the daemon process to restart the worker (and refresh the configuration) after a configuration file change is detected on disk..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

preserve_clipboard.description: If true, Espanso will attempt to preserve the previous clipboard content after an expansion has taken place..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

apply_patch.description: If false, avoid applying the built-in patches to the current config..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

undo_backspace.description: When enabled, espanso automatically "reverts" an expansion if the user presses the Backspace key afterwards. This is not available on some platform/configurations.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

show_notifications.description: If false, disable all notifications.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

show_icon.description: If false, avoid showing the espanso icon on the system's tray bar. Note: currently not working on Linux.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

x11_use_xclip_backend.description: If true, use the `xclip` command to implement the clipboard instead of the built-in native module on X11. You'll need to install the `xclip` command. Enable if the clipboard "get stuck" for some applications on Linux.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

win32_exclude_orphan_events.description: If true, filter out keyboard events without an explicit HID device source on Windows. This is needed to filter out the software-generated events, including those from Espanso, but might need to be disabled when using some software-level keyboards. Disabling this option might conflict with the undo feature..  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

paste_shortcut.description: Customize the keyboard shortcut used to paste an expansion. This should follow this format: CTRL+SHIFT+V.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? Yes

search_shortcut.description: Hotkey used to show the Search UI.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

search_trigger.description: Trigger used to show the Search UI.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

toggle_key.description: Defines the key that disables/enables espanso when double pressed.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

word_separators.description: Chars that when pressed mark the start and end of a word. Examples of this are . or ,.  May this be used in App-Specific Configs? No

enable_passive.description: This boolean turns on passive mode, which allows users to select text, then use a hotkey to trigger text replacement after typing. See https://espanso.org/docs/legacy/passive-mode/.

passive_key.description: The key a user presses to trigger text expansion for selected text, when Espanso is set to passive mode. See https://espanso.org/docs/legacy/passive-mode/
